channel.title: Portal 2 : Repercussions
channel.description:
[url=https://cubeupload.com/im/890Oov.gif]![](upload://yTmzHr8nBeomzD8lvVb96NGdqiq.gif)[/url]
[COLOR='DarkRed']Hello![/SIZE]
I've been considering doing a thread on here about my portal 2 mod project and it's Sunday so I have nothing better to do.
[url=https://cubeupload.com/im/pnU2Ou.png]![](upload://jG9ypWoJ2nvqkQMU0qnlYKrOB6f.png)[/url]
The mod is story based and supposed to bring in more depth about Aperture's past and relation to Black Mesa in the style of Half-Life data-disks like Blue Shift and Opposing Force,taking place during Portal 2's events.
[url=https://www.moddb.com]![](upload://lbUdo9cyuQDTJqaN8z7zPEubyoT.png)[/url] [url]https://www.moddb.com/mods/repercussions-mod[/url]
[url=https://cubeupload.com/im/ZVJ8SS.png]![](upload://6RXebYiIWDftzIHTln1m10mE2oh.png)[/url]
[b][COLOR='DarkOrange']Video:[/SIZE][/b]
[b][COLOR='DarkRed']Intro/trailer/thingamajig:[/SIZE][/b] [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yms0qNRJCi8&list=UUmjx_fdjsmMTFJEc3FA--pg[/url]
[COLOR='DarkRed'][b]Aperture Quantum Tunneling Device Mark IV:[/b][/SIZE] [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=42kIY7MJn-g[/url]
[COLOR='DarkRed'][b] Older gameplay video:[/b][/SIZE] [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xr2JnznGtAM&list=UUmjx_fdjsmMTFJEc3FA--pg[/url]
[b][COLOR='DarkOrange']Music:[/SIZE][/b]
Tracks made by me:
[COLOR='DarkRed']●[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ybFqo4Krn8&list=UUmjx_fdjsmMTFJEc3FA--pg[/url]
[COLOR='DarkRed']● [url]https://soundcloud.com/lamarrmelon/ascend_v2[/url]
The mod's soundtrack composer, Kevin Alexander Baggett's stuff:
[COLOR='DarkRed']● [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e7SxlvA3Lhs&list=UUmjx_fdjsmMTFJEc3FA--pg[/url]
[COLOR='DarkRed']● [url]https://soundcloud.com/russiangodfather/sets/portal-2-repercussions[/url]
[b][COLOR='DarkOrange']Pics:[/SIZE][/b]
(You can find the rest on the Moddb don't want to clutter up the thread too much.)
[url=https://cubeupload.com/im/Qj8xev.png]![](upload://opjUvSGYMpOIqgCVIiRuOUTLHcK.jpeg)[/url] [url=https://cubeupload.com]![](upload://xpdzyaXCzUzxfYfpy3co1zafV7U.jpeg) ![](upload://fE4EubQnIU5PRuYc7CtTVKKybIU.jpeg) ![](upload://fht2frMxOWETvuYxRZANv0szDCQ.jpeg) ![](upload://wXyrjdwLbumNCTRMIV3Ih6iCvCa.jpeg) ![](upload://z3Q1cPQyRD0uWf5dXAnzb0JOqBF.jpeg) ![](upload://fxnJd0nUOPYJFun3XgSHD79QfOS.jpeg) ![](upload://nlWJGU0mMpknqrgS82tP8vS64GG.jpeg)[/url]
I'll keep updating this thread with further progress!

item.title: Portal 2 : Repercussions
item.dc:creator: Kaltsu
item.description:
This is looking absolutely fantastic! Question: how did you make that particle effect? Those orange particles flowing upwards?

Lamarr:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zHJPPaXgd0c

That pillar what it had coming.

In other words: how can I do the same?

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 : Repercussions
item.dc:creator: gladoscake122
item.description:
Lamarr:
gladoscake122:

The name of the video is 'GG_3883"… does this mean Aperture made portals to Xen? come to think of it, long-fall equipment would help in an environment like that… And one of your videos show a sign that says ‘Borderworld Research’ so I’m guessing we are going to see Xen related things in Aperture? that would be epic!
Your work is stunning, you put a much darker spin on the history of Aperture than Valve ever did, definitely more fitting with the Half-Life Universe.

The music as always is simply superb.

cbartondock:

Someone (user Alex_Demolisher) just posted on the moddb comments for this that the mod has been cancelled. I must admit I would be heartbroken if that were the case, but I also thought it would be pretty weird for Lamarr not to say something. I wanted to check here. Can I assume user Alex_Demolisher is full of it? (please say yes)

CPU:
cbartondock:

Someone (user Alex_Demolisher) just posted on the moddb comments for this that the mod has been cancelled. I must admit I would be heartbroken if that were the case, but I also thought it would be pretty weird for Lamarr not to say something. I wanted to check here. Can I assume user Alex_Demolisher is full of it? (please say yes)

He’s full of

Ain’t dead till I say it’s dead.

Lamarr:
gladoscake122:

The name of the video is 'GG_3883"… does this mean Aperture made portals to Xen? come to think of it, long-fall equipment would help in an environment like that… And one of your videos show a sign that says ‘Borderworld Research’ so I’m guessing we are going to see Xen related things in Aperture? that would be epic!
Your work is stunning, you put a much darker spin on the history of Aperture than Valve ever did, definitely more fitting with the Half-Life Universe.

The music as always is simply superb.

cbartondock:

Someone (user Alex_Demolisher) just posted on the moddb comments for this that the mod has been cancelled. I must admit I would be heartbroken if that were the case, but I also thought it would be pretty weird for Lamarr not to say something. I wanted to check here. Can I assume user Alex_Demolisher is full of it? (please say yes)

CPU:
cbartondock:

Someone (user Alex_Demolisher) just posted on the moddb comments for this that the mod has been cancelled. I must admit I would be heartbroken if that were the case, but I also thought it would be pretty weird for Lamarr not to say something. I wanted to check here. Can I assume user Alex_Demolisher is full of it? (please say yes)

He’s full of

Ain’t dead till I say it’s dead.

Say. How about a 2017 Nov media update? Or maybe it’ll be a Christmas present? but as always, take your time, Creator. I can see Repurcussions going as big as PS: Mel, I mean, you were part of the team for that, the community is ever so talented and creative!

I always knew you from Half-Life fan content years ago, gee, where did the time go? but I never saw this Portal side to your works. You’ve come so far since then. Did you ever make Portal content when you were mostly focused on Half-Life and do you prefer Portal or Portal 2?

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 : Repercussions
item.dc:creator: gladoscake122
item.description:
The name of the video is 'GG_3883"… does this mean Aperture made portals to Xen? come to think of it, long-fall equipment would help in an environment like that… And one of your videos show a sign that says ‘Borderworld Research’ so I’m guessing we are going to see Xen related things in Aperture? that would be epic!
Your work is stunning, you put a much darker spin on the history of Aperture than Valve ever did, definitely more fitting with the Half-Life Universe.

The music as always is simply superb.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 : Repercussions
item.dc:creator: Matt_the_Czar
item.description:
It’s nice to see this still going after so long. Keep it up!

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 : Repercussions
item.dc:creator: MichaelTannock
item.description:
I don’t think we’ve seen any enemies yet have we, so will this be an entirely puzzle based game?

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 : Repercussions
item.dc:creator: lambdaman
item.description:
Lamarr, that’s some awesome work you’ve done.
I wanted to post a clap gif but there aren’t enough in the world.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 : Repercussions
item.dc:creator: Admiral_Sakai
item.description:
This is actually pretty neat! I was never a big fan of the level design in the Portal games, and found it pretty empty and repetitive, but this is anything but!

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 : Repercussions
item.dc:creator: Johnwalter
item.description:
I refuse to believe this was made by one person. It’s unbelievably good!
The pulse reminds me of the INSIDE game. Really scary and intriguing!

Keep up the fantastic work man, at your own pace of course.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 : Repercussions
item.dc:creator: Dragunov2
item.description:
GOOSEBUMPS!

It remembers me a bit of the core found in METASTASIS, but this one has a much better atmosphere!

I can feel and smell the air!

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 : Repercussions
item.dc:creator: CPU
item.description:
Impressive once again! You should be proud!

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 : Repercussions
item.dc:creator: Lamarr
item.description:
Thank you! I did redesign the area to put more emphasis on the epicenter of the pulses in a vista-like fashion.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 : Repercussions
item.dc:creator: Madcat1030
item.description:
Lamarr. You are why I come back. I must. Must. Must play this some day.

Now, is that a re-design of an area from a previous video, or a new area deeper in towards the core?

EDIT: Just watched an older video, recognized the EXTREME CAUTION sign from the beginning, and am now quite sure this is a huge upgrade from the old version. You, fine sir, are amazing.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Portal 2 : Repercussions
item.dc:creator: Johnwalter
item.description:
OMG, that leap animation is soo smooth! You deserve a cookie!
One question, are the metal grabbers at the front of the Portal gun made with copper?
I just find it weird since the metal heats up so much when you grab something, after when it’s at room temperature, would that be a realistic colour?

That is the Main menu background?
Looks awesome!

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 : Repercussions
item.dc:creator: Madcat1030
item.description:
STAHHHHP. Why is everything you show so cool.

I mean, aside from the obvious bit that showing uncool or less cool parts would not drum up as much excitement.

But my god are your maps just some of the most incredible looking things I’ve seen.

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 : Repercussions
item.dc:creator: Lamarr
item.description:
I think you’re perceiving it with the wrong sense of scale, both the sphere pillar are absolutely massive.
The red circled part is the player next to the pillar:

1322×772

Read full topic

item.title: Portal 2 : Repercussions
item.dc:creator: CPU
item.description:
It really is beautiful but I had a couple of problems.
One is that when the pillar falls, it falls WAY too slowly. The upward particle movements look and appear normal but the movement of the pillar just isn’t.
The other thing was the electrical bolts sounded just like far off lightning instead of something closer to the observer and more electrical.

Other than that, it was gorgeous!

Read full topic
